title: Why is K-pop more popular than J-pop in the U.S.? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because KPop is more westernised that JPop is. And Korea knows this,and not just that but the government also is supporting the expansion of Korean culture, so they try to assimilate as much as American style so it feels more international. Like this:  You can clearly see American style fused with Korean culture. And that is why Korean try to expand outside Korea into the west(USA and EUROPE). But that doesn't mean Japan doesn't expand. And is not Just China,Indonesia has JKT48 and other counted have totally original groups like Thailand's Sweat16:  So ,In conclusion, Japan does what Asia want,and Korea does what USA may like…sort of.
